title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Radio Active  Guard House," Reverse Side", 1980s
medium: Black and color marking pens, graphite, white crayon on white tracing paper
inscribed:
Inscribed in graphite, upper margin:  Removable Fiberglass/Metal; upper margin center:  1/8 = 30 mm; in white crayon, center:  DANGER; in graphite, lower left margin:  TAMBOUR; lower margin:  cork/alum/frame; various mathematical notations throughout
TO BE CHECKED
description: Four panel screen on wheels.  Two left panels form a gray and brown guard house with red roof, which is attached at right to black metal gate with red "danger" sign.  This panel is attached at right to black panel with bunny head and stepped cut outs topped by red dome with red poles on either side.  Small assembly diagrams in left, upper and lower margins.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Radio Active  Guard House," Reverse Side", 1980s.
1980s. Black and color marking pens, graphite, white crayon on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-96.
